Coral calcification i.e., making corals releases CO. No, really. Ocean warming and acidification will reduce coral calcification, which could increase annual ocean carbon uptake by 1.25 billion tonnes of CO by 2050. So killing corals is bad for biodiversity but potentially good for climate.
